turns.text: Do you use credit cards good bit
turns.label: qy

turns.text: I do and I wish I didnt
turns.label: na

turns.text: Before I got married uh about the only credit cards I used were gas cards because I didnt like carrying you know --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- the cash with me all the time but I just never wanted to get into the hang-up of using credit cards and --
-- having all those bills hanging over my head
In fact I remember getting my first MasterCard and the only reason I got it was you know there was while --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- years ago when you couldnt cash check --
And so thats why I went ahead and got one
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah Well actually I I have whole wallet full of credit cards
turns.label: b

turns.text: I dont use them very often Um oh I may use I try to use at least one gasoline credit card week and try to use different one so that you know I have keep those active
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I have half dozen department store credit cards and I Ill use those if I need to run in and buy dozen pair hose right quick --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- or something like that just enough to keep them active My biggies are the VISA MasterCard and Discover
And for the most part I had used those for like uh charging airline tickets where I can pay for those you know you could --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- make the transaction over the telephone or I fly Southwest good little bit which means I can just run that card through the machine

Uh and it saves lot time And thats what I was using it for However we had had very pressing financial family crisis which said you have no alternative you must have the money to do this with and you do not have any other options --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- so I charged all three of those cards up and right now I am paying and praying
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and thats exactly what weve I mean --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- I have to say I have been thankful for them because there were times when --
-- when we had to have the money --
-- we had no way around it --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and the only way to do it is go get you know an advance --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and so like you were paying for it but --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- its one of those Im glad it was there
Right I never did use it for an advance Most of my charges were uh medications
Didnt have cash for the medications or it was uh the doctor would accept MasterCard or VISA
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh lot of times you can get by using those for uh uh - different labs will --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Do you find now though that even some doctors wont Ive found some doctors that say you know - I was so used to doctors or medical care places taking credit cards and so many of them dont anymore
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Well I have not - like I said that was just one period in my life where that was critical
I dont generally charge I say well I need checkup in six months and I kind of set that aside --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and just pay for it Im reimbursed on insurance anyway and I can handle you know paying for it and waiting two or three weeks
Getting into credit card fiasco is easy
turns.label: sv

turns.text: It is easy and its very difficult to get out I just cringe every month when I see those interest charges
turns.label: sv

turns.text: I say wow I I ought to go to the credit union and borrow the money and pay this off Big deal Im saving two percent
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Right But you know the interest even though it bothered me it didnt used to bother me so much because of course you could list it on Schedule and you got all your interest you know --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- deductions and now theyve messed that up to where it really is financial burden to have to pay it
And but it but it is easy to get into credit card problem and I I think about young people that think you know - theres kind of that feeling of hey its so neat I have my first credit card --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- and and they just dont understand that you still have to be able to make the payments
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- its not just paying back what youve charged its --
Uh you send in uh uh fifty dollars youre going to pay twenty twenty-five in interest charges
turns.label: sv

turns.text: You only get half of that paid for the principal so Im looking at three or four years before my balances are cleared on those charge accounts
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Now as the monthly payment uh I mean as the monthly payment amount goes down that will free up more cash where I can continue to make the larger payments
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh as long as I dont have major disaster where I have to use it again I can I can do that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Meantime though Im not building any reserves
turns.label: sd

turns.text: No and thats frightening to me
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Anything that I could be put aside into savings is going for interest on those cards
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh I I just I my husband is in business for himself --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- I work for I but he doesnt --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and uh were uh I Ive kind of got my fingers cr- crossed Ive learned when youre in business for yourself that that you dont count on something until its happened --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- you know but hes got some you know its those once in lifetime cases and after ten years hes got two of them --
-- and they should pay through next month and and were both just looking at each other every night going man that will pay off like both of our MasterCards you know
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And you know just in one lump because thats the only way you can do it is to have big chunk of money --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- or its like you say you pay forever
turns.label: sv

turns.text: And so Im really looking forward to that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well you either need big chunk of money or you need large reserve --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- so that if you do charge on that account you can make single lump sum payment Now those are very handy --
-- if you have the reserves and you can make lump sum payments sharp good --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- because youre living on the other guys money for while
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But I can promise you that those credit card companies are going to ride high on my money
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And it just irks me I say my gosh I had to work three hours just to pay the interest on this and Ive got three cards Ive lost whole day of my life --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- what am I working for today
Yeah yeah And that just blows my mind I my house is paid for my car is paid for Ive got some home improvements but even the payment on that doesnt equal the payment on one of those credit cards
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Boy I wish I could say that my house and - well my car is paid for now It was wrecked three weeks ago but but you see again --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- the credit cards came in handy I had to have the money to pay rental car pay this pay that till the insurance company pays back
-- that is good healthy safe use --
Because you know thats coming back to pay it off
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh uh-huh Uh I went to seminar they said dont ever use your credit card for consumable items You only use credit cards for investments
turns.label: aa

turns.text: I said for crying out loud if I had the money to in- you know --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: -- if I could do some investing youd have to invest at better than twenty percent earnings in order --
-- to pay for the payments on the credit card
That doesnt make bit of sense to me I thought --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- God dang where is his pencil
Well the smart half was dont pay it for consumables dont you know if you cant afford to go to restaurant and eat out and pay cash dont put it on credit card --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- you know and and so that that is the smart half
But uh and I can remember before we had kids we did that lot but it was no biggie --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- you know because we could pay it off while after kids and youre paying child care and other things all of sudden its not so easy to pay off so we cut that out real quick
And uh but I I do like having them there There is bit of security in having the credit cards and knowing that in times of crisis they are there to use --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- but you have to have very good sense of saving and or --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: You also have to have that willingness to commit to that --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- because youre committing good portion of your life and income when you do it
